intro: Varronia haitiensis, commonly known as Haitian varronia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, specifically Haiti. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along streambanks. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds. Varronia haitiensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
